column7: Steppes, on clay and solonetzic soils, and as a weed of arable land[74]. Pastures, roadsides, fields and waste areas at elevations of 100 - 2200 metres in western China[266].

column16: Chorispora tenella is a ANNUAL growing to 0.2 m (0ft 8in).  See above for USDA hardiness. It is hardy to UK zone 8.  It is in flower in July, and the seeds ripen from July to August. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Insects.  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils and prefers  well-drained soil. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils. It cannot grow in the shade. It prefers dry or  moist soil.
column21: Leaves - raw[105, 177]. They make a good early salad[2].
